alert.note: Alert for Custer (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 9:20AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Idaho... East Fork Big Wood River at Gimlet affecting Blaine County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Idaho... North Fork Big Lost River at Wild Horse near Chilly affecting Custer County. .Heavy rains on Sunday combined with heightened snow melt in the central Idaho mountains have caused some of the rivers and streams to go into minor flood stage. With light precipitation accumulations for the next two days, some of the river stages have already lowered, and others will lower by Tuesday morning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...North Fork Big Lost River at Wild Horse near Chilly. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.1 feet, or 1174 cfs... Homes along the East Fork of the Big Lost River from Wildhorse Creek to Star Hope Creek may see flooding along with lowland flooding from the confluence of Big Lost River North Fork upsteram of the East Fork of Big Lost River to the Copper Basin Airstrip. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM MDT Monday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM MDT Monday was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river stage is expected to level off and start decreasing by tonight. - Flood stage is 5.1 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.4 feet on 05/20/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
